text: Alpha Lacertae, also known as Î± Lacertae, is a single white-coloured star in the constellation of Lacerta. It is located 103 light years away from the Sun. It is the brightest star in constellation Lacerta with an apparent visual magnitude of 3.76. The star is moving closer to the Earth with a heliocentric radial velocity of -4.5 km/s. ==References== Category:Stars
title: Alpha Lacertae
